attributes.action: Ban cropping/clipping of a dog's ears
attributes.background: Ban the cropping/clipping of a dogs ears, unless it's for medical reasons. Most commonly seen in pit breeds, cropping a puppies ears purely for cosmetic reasons is mutilation. It's cruel and serves no purpose for their health. Only for the owners enjoyment.

attributes.action: Allow our FIREFIGHTERS to use seized & impounded vehicles for training purposes.
attributes.background: FIREFIGHTERS have to purchase scrap vehicles in order to train in essential skills such as roof & door removal, car fires & people extraction so that WE can be saved in emergency situations. WHY are we crushing vehicles seized at the roadside when we could GIVE these to the FIRE FIGHTERS!? Help NOW!
attributes.additional_details: Firefighters have to buy scrap vehicles from their own budgets at times when front line services are being cut and cars, seized at the roadside by the Police are being crushed into cubes when they could be used in training. Purchased vehicles are used VERY sparingly in order to extend training as they cannot afford to buy them when seized cars are being cubed daily. These skills that require practice save lives - please sign this petition as it could be your life saved by your signature one day!

attributes.action: Youths 14-18 required to be CRB checked if working at a youth organisation
attributes.background: Children at youth organisations in the UK are being put at risk as there is no current guidelines or law allowing a youth worker/leader to check on the Sex offenders register about a person who is under 18.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to change to allow a youth who will be mixing with children to be checked against the register, as under 18 no CRB checks are ever made and this is dangerous.

attributes.action: Provide free accommodation for ex-service personnel
attributes.background: As Veterans have served our country and risked their lives, why should they be left out in the cold with no food or water. All Veterans should be given accommodation after leaving the Forces until they are able to support themselves again.

attributes.action: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 until 23rd June, 2031.
attributes.background: That the Government delay triggering Article 50 of the Treaty on European Union until 23rd June, 2031, that is a period of 15 years from the referendum date. This delay is to enable the economy to stabilise and allow proper preparations to be put in place for the separation from the European Union.

attributes.action: Make diagnosed medical need the same as disability for discrimination laws
attributes.background: As someone suffering from diagnosed coeliac disease, I am appalled that there is no legislation which protects our rights (and those with other medically diagnosed conditions) from discrimination, unless that diagnosis happens to be recognised as a disability in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst restaurants, cafes and other public bodies and places have to make reasonable adjustments for people with disability, there is no requirement for them to do likewise for a medically diagnosed condition, such as diabetes and coeliac disease.

Hospitals often fail to provide any gluten free menu options for coeliacs and despite NICE guidelines, the NHS trusts are withdrawing prescriptions for gluten free food, the only treatment for coeliacs (yet still prescribe food for other conditions).

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Introduce a law that enforces companies to grant menstrual leave to women
attributes.background: Most times, high menstrual pains may bring about heightened exhaustion, reduced proficiency, and expression of emotional uneasiness. The pain can be so intense sometimes that it might require urgent medical attention.Policies that grant workers paid sick leaves would help to solve these problems.

attributes.action: Introduce job requirements for government cabinet roles.
attributes.background:
Cabinet positions in the government should be based on meeting strict job criteria as in industry. 

For example, Michael Gove was both the Secretary of State for Education and Justice, yet the different roles require specific knowledge and expertise that is not immediately transferable.
attributes.additional_details:
Applying to a senior position in any role requires a senior level of expertise relating to that role.

If the public are subject to such strict requirements then certainly our ministers should be too. This would ensure that the policy makers have a credible knowledge and experience to make the right policies for the country, not policies that align solely with their ideology.

attributes.action: Create NHS teams for the atypical patients & stop them falling through the gaps
attributes.background: I have spent my life living with complex illnesses, and this coupled with also having a rare illness, I have found myself falling through the gaps in the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Because my situation and symptoms are 'atypical' I have spent the last few years being passed around in the system to different departments and teams, but never being taken on by their services as I do not meet the criteria or "fit in their box". This has been made worse by the funding crisis, as no one is prepared to take on the atypical cases.

I propose the creation of specialist multi-disciplinary teams to take on the atypical cases, so that no one also falls through the gaps in the system.

attributes.action: Give the Public easy access to motorway CCTV cameras
attributes.background: The CCTV camera feeds provided by Traffic England can only be accessed via their official website, which is slow, cumbersome and not user-friendly. The Public should be allowed to create bookmarks/shortcuts to their favourite camera, or list of cameras, quickly and easily.
attributes.additional_details: Traffic Wales already provide this service, but England does not. During consultation, Highways England were unable to provide any legitimate reason for not allowing the Public to bookmark specific cameras or set up their own websites that show the live feeds in a more user-friendly format.

attributes.action: Make all incontinence products available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Many people across the UK, of all ages, suffer from bowel or bladder incontinence.
Across many areas, the NHS is lacking options available for people having to live with this condition.
We are offered adult nappies only,when there are other better options such as pull ups. Make those free on NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Bowel or bladder incontinence is a very difficult symptom to deal with. I believe many more adult continence products should be available from the NHS. Different people have different issues, and some products are suited to some, but not others. Give suffers the choice.

attributes.action: Give the UK a 2nd EU Referendum or call a General Election
attributes.background: The majority vote from the EU referendum in June 2016 was 4% (51.8 Leave vs. 48.1 Remain). This margin is too small for the Government to take the United Kingdom out of the EU. Since June the people of the UK now know more about the terms of Brexit so we should have a 2nd vote.
attributes.additional_details:
The case for leaving the EU is too big for any of us to comprehend fully. It is economical and cultural. We can not allow the matter of British 'principle' and 'sticking to our guns' to allow the Government to dogmatically pursue the goal to take the United Kingdom out of the European Union. 

Offering the British people a second vote isn't 'going back' on David Cameron's assertion that this is a 'once in a lifetime vote', it is quite simply the right thing to do. The stakes are simply too high.

attributes.action: Stop the demolition of the rest facilities on A35 Dorchester
attributes.background:
These are used by approx 2000 people a week. 
Demolishing these toilets is not the answer, they are a necessity. 
Build another rest area or sort the vandalism problem out but you can not just demolish something that is so obviously needed.
What happened to drivers being encouraged to rest.
attributes.additional_details:
Even Highways England have not denied how busy these facilities are, their reason for demolition is vandalism. 
Demolishing these toilets is not the answer. Shame on you Highways England.

attributes.action: Ban the use of meat and dairy produce at all government functions and meals
attributes.background: Meat and dairy is the greatest contributor to greenhouse gases. It is also a driver of rainforest destruction. It condemns billions of sentient animals to confined lives and a violent death. It is urgent that the UK government takes a lead in adopting Vegan diets for official functions and meals

attributes.action: Retain local anaesthesia, prior to donation, for those blood donors who need it.
attributes.background:
Donating blood is, generally, pain-free but for some it can be very painful.  Anaesthesia is available for those donors who need it but
from April 2017 it will no longer be available.  

In my own case, I was advised never to give blood without anaesthetic after an incident at a donor session.
attributes.additional_details:
Blood & Transplant make the point that their Donor Carers have excellent needle skills and that B&T have developed various distraction and coping techniques to enable donors to donate without anaesthesia.
For those who simply have a fear of needles, this is an excellent step forward.  For those whose anatomy makes donation a complicated, prolonged and painful experience such techniques will be of little use.
The withdrawal of Lidocaine will only save the NHS about £30,000 per year

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Main Home
attributes.background: People need to move house for many reasons, job, health, family, personal circumstances change etc. they should be able to move easily, without a financial penalty being paid to the government. But they can't because of stamp duty. It locks people in unsuitable homes and restricts movement.
attributes.additional_details: Most have to add the stamp duty tax to their mortgage. How can taking out a loan for 25-30 years to pay the government for the privilege of moving home be right. Stamp duty tax is damaging the property market, peoples lives & the economy. Many people that want to, or need to move cannot, simply because of the enormous cost of stamp duty. Stamp Duty tax needs to be abolished.

attributes.action: Apply VAT on airfares to better fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is underfunded; at the end of 2015/16 the NHS had a deficit of £1.85 billion. Aviation is lightly taxed but harmful, eg it impairs children's learning ability and is detrimental to wildlife. It is also exacerbating our climate crisis and in 2014 produced over 11% of the UK’s total emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
Airline passengers do not pay fuel duty or VAT and APD can be as low as £13. We might think this makes annual holidays affordable but in fact undertaxed flights largely benefit affluent people who fly several times a year; 70% of flights are taken by only 15% of adults.

My petition is to apply VAT on airfares and for the additional revenue to be used to support our NHS. Most of us like an annual holiday but those of us who can afford 2 to 3 holidays each year can also afford to pay more tax.

attributes.action: A motion to call a vote on MPs confidence in the government's future NHS plans.
attributes.background: NHS is under increasing strain. Staff are overworked, NHS vacancies are left unfilled (highlighting a need for increased training through government subsides) and doctors have been accused of not doing enough. This cannot continue. We need a change of plan which should be put to a parliament vote.
attributes.additional_details:
ITV report https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jAg2aHgVBSA 
Sky News Report http://www.classicfm.com/radio/news/uk-world/nhs-crisis-theresa-may-frustrated-over-gp-ope/
Debate with lots of evidence http://parliamentlive.tv/event/index/b18b254b-2450-4a4d-86d0-947792490a6c?in=16:30:00
Leak showing extent of 2017 winter crisis http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-38570960

attributes.action: Mandatory for all employers to offer a phased return to work for new parents
attributes.background: Offering working parents a phased return to work will help to provide a smoother transition back to work. Providing the stay at home parent with an enhanced support system and allowing the working parent more time to form a positive relationship without as much of a financial burden.

attributes.action: Include School Transport to salary sacrifice schemes to enable tax/NI savings
attributes.background: Many working parents are facing high costs for self funding school transport. For some families this can be £1000s each year. We would like school transport vouchers to be included in the government salary sacrifice schemes in the same way that childcare vouchers and cycle to work schemes are.
attributes.additional_details: The government currently funds school transport for children attending their nearest school, for many families the nearest school is not the best option so they choose to self-fund transport and send their child to another school. For parents making this decision they are generating £1000s in cost savings to local councils as the council no longer has the financial obligation to provide transport. We ask the government to support working families with this simple change.

attributes.action: Make equal rights the heart of any trade deal with America.
attributes.background: Soon we will begin discussions with America on a trade deal; we should ensure that equal worker rights based on gender, sexuality, religion and race will be enshrined in this deal.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has always had a special relationship with America. This relationship has been forged as two nations who have fought side by side to defend the rights of the individual. Brexit has given us an opportunity to create our own trade deals with nations. We should use these trade deals to cement the shared values we hold dear.

attributes.action: Form cross party committee to agree strategy & funding of the NHS & care support
attributes.background: We need to agree a long term strategy for the NHS, to ensure we maximise our incredible resources and expertise. We have difficult choices to make: modernising to ensure we offer a consistent 7 day service; identify a way to fund the increasing demand; and how we fund elderly care in the community.
attributes.additional_details:
We have an increasingly ageing population with improved medical advances. The service needs to remove the administrative burdens and focus on efficient world class care, which will require moving to a manufacturing shift pattern impacting ALL staff, requiring cross party support. 
To maximise the use of hospital beds we need to review the control & funding of aftercare/nursing homes to ensure quality and remove the bottlenecks between the NHS and local authorities, changes to tax structure?

attributes.action: Include women in the national screening programme for abdominal aortic aneurysms
attributes.background: Public Health England run a national screening programme for men aged ≥65 to detect abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA). If left undetected, a AAA rupture is fatal in 90% of cases. The condition is not unique to men, women also suffer and die from AAA ruptures. So why aren't women also screened?
attributes.additional_details:
Screening is a way of detecting an aneurysm early. If the abdominal aortic artery gets particularly swollen, you might feel a pulsating feeling or pain in your stomach or back pain. If you don't experience this, you won’t know you have an aneurysm until it bursts, when it becomes an emergency and is usually fatal.
Ruptured AAAs are less common in women and, on average, occur 10 years later than in men.So why is there not a screening programme for women aged 75 or above? Women are equal!

attributes.action: Deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary.
attributes.background: Following the demise of the NHS through lack of funding please deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary to change the direction of the NHS and protect it for future generation's. Our lives depend on it!

attributes.action: Add Euro Indexation to the State Pension triple-lock
attributes.background: Since the Brexit vote on 23 June, the value of the pound has been falling. Those on private pensions have seen a surge in value as international companies and world markets prosper. Average earnings and the consumer price index will remain muted, leading to a fall in the value of the State Pension.
attributes.additional_details: On 23 June, the pound was worth 1.30169 Euro (ref. OANDA) - by the end of the year it had lost more than 10% of its value. This trend is likely to continue. By November, the CPI was only 1.2% (ref. ONS). - The Pensions Committee is thinking of scrapping the triple-lock, but we suggest replacing "or 2.5%" with "or 1.30169/FX" where FX is the value of the Pound in terms of the Euro.

attributes.action: Allow children access to more speech therapy on the NHS.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to offer more speech therapy on the NHS.  I have been fighting to get my son help for 2 years. We have to pay privately for someone to listen to us. We are seen weekly privately, but the NHS won't offer anywhere close to this. Our son has made so much progress having weekly sessions.

attributes.action: Any EU national came after BREXIT referendum Should not get right to Stay in UK
attributes.background:
UK is already overcrowded,
NHS is streched, 
British Family is struggling to get choice of education as schools are already over crowded, 
EU haven't provided guarantee for UK national so why should uk give guarantee for EU national
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority has said the EU membership fee figure of £19 billion a year, or £350 million a week,
The UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Britons' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU,even though there are significantly more EU citizens in the UK than UK citizens in the EU.
For example the UK pays France £147,685,772, but France only pays UK £6,730,292 and the UK pays Germany £25,873,954 but Germany only pays the UK £2,189,664

attributes.action: Provide anonymity for those accused of sexual assault until they're found guilty
attributes.background: While we find complete sympathy with all men and women who have been raped, the anonymity provided to the accusers must be extended to the accused until a verdict is reached. Careers are easily destroyed on allegations alone - even when the accused is found innocent. The imbalance is unjustifiable.
attributes.additional_details: In many circumstances in the past careers and livelihoods have been ruined by such allegations - even when the accused were eventually found innocent in a court of law. For many of the same reasons that the accusers are granted anonymity, we should extend this to accused to allow them protection from public scrutiny until they are found guilty.

attributes.action: To make November 11th a bank holiday
attributes.background: To remember all the fallen heros

attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.

attributes.action: Consider a second runway for Gatwick
attributes.background: Why allocate a 3rd runway to Heathrow when Gatwick will fund 2nd runway

attributes.action: Make it statutory for Police to have dogs in a property secured before entering
attributes.background: There are currently no Police protocols for dogs being secured before they enter a property. Dogs can not differentiate between a police officer or trespasser! Many dogs are destroyed for being labelled "dangerously out of control", when in fact, they felt threatened and are protecting their owner.
attributes.additional_details: Regardless of why police are at a property, making it a requirement for homeowners to be asked to secure dogs later to be retrieved by force dog section, will not only protect officers, but also the public if the dog(s) were to escape. Innocent dogs are destroyed due to police errors, Officers are trained to foresee hostile situations and in some cases things can escalate quickly and knowing that any dogs are safely secured will protect not only them but also the police and the public.

attributes.action: End negotiations with the EU forthwith.
attributes.background: The PM has no mandate to negotiate with the EU. We voted for a hard Brexit and demand it. Time to tell the EU "no deal, end of negotiations, goodbye."

attributes.action: Repeal the handgun ban of 1996/97
attributes.background: The handgun ban had no effect on crime and did nothing but punish legitimate handgun shooters
attributes.additional_details: http://theconversation.com/dunblane-massacre-20-years-on-how-britain-rewrote-its-gun-laws-and-the-challenge-it-faces-now-55896

attributes.action: Put 1p on income tax and from proceeds fund NHS deficit £6b and social care £6b.
attributes.background: NHS has a deficit of c£6b pa. We also have inadequate social care provision (why hospitals are full of elderly not poorly people). I  believe the vast majority of people would be happy to pay an extra 1p in the £ to solve both problems. Funds to be ring fenced (so can't be spent on anything else).
attributes.additional_details: Seems so obvious but political parties are hamstrung in taking the initiative. It would require cross party agreement so that politics can be set to one side and common sense (what everyone knows but can't admit) be allowed to prevail. The important bit is to guarantee to taxpayers that the extra money can/will only be used for these two purposes (so controlled not by the government of the day but by some independent body).

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the government to borrow from the National Insurance Fund
attributes.background: Government borrows surplus set aside for welfare to pay off the National Debt. It is estimated that they owe the NI fund £24 billion. NI money can only be used to fund NHS and welfare. The Government gets around this by lending money to itself, spending elsewhere instead of properly funding the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/560695/National_Insurance_Fund_Accounts_Great_Britain_2015_to_2016.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory refresher course and driving test for people over 70
attributes.background:
Far too often we hear of older drivers who have lost control of their car and caused serious damage to themselves and others, sometimes killing people. 

Many know their elderly relatives are no longer fit for driving but are unable to stop them from getting behind a wheel.
attributes.additional_details:
To make our roads safer and help avoid these tragedies we should introduce a mandatory test to make sure drivers are still fit to be on the road. 

These courses, tests and lessons will provide additional income and help protect the public from accidents that could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Apply diplomatic pressure on China to stop repatriating North Koreans.
attributes.background: North Koreans are suffering at the hands of a tyrannical regime. They are starving. Many do not have access to basic commodities, are not free to talk or act as they choose and are in fear of severe punishment. Many escape to China to find freedom, they are often exploited by traffickers or sold.
attributes.additional_details:
If they are found by the Chinese authorities they are sent back to North Korea where they are punished as defectors (e.g. life imprisonment in deplorable conditions). Repatriating refugees in this way is a clear violation of human rights and they should be allowed safe passage through China to a country who will accept them (e.g. South Korea).
http://www.libertyinnorthkorea.org/
http://www.nkfreedom.org/index.aspx
http://www.northkoreanrefugees.com/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ei-gGvLWOZI

attributes.action: Hi my name is Caitlin gray and I would like to make  bullying against the law
attributes.background: People that get bullied can't handle it and want to end their life with no question about it and I want to change that I want to make it stop because we shouldn't have to deal with it so I would like to make bullying against the law.
attributes.additional_details:
My friend commited suicide due to bullying for being transgender.and on social media you could see young people have commited suicide because they cannot deal with bullying. I think it is wrong for us to have to end our life because we live in fear and dread of going to school or even out side. It needs to stop and I'm crying out for something to stop it and I feel strongly for this to be heard and stopped. People record it on there phones and laugh it's mostly on YouTube the bullying and its sad. I want it to stop I want someone to do something about it and not just brush it away like its nothing. We are to young to kill ourselves and we have a future and dreams.
Regards Caitlin Gray

attributes.action: Allow people who are born blind in one eye, to register as partially sighted.
attributes.background: If you are born with eyesight in one eye you, cant register as partially sighted unless you have problems with your other eye.

attributes.action: Make Bullying in the workplace a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Bullying is wrong. Bullying goes on in the workplace.  It can be being left out , whatever it may be.  It can be being ignored.  It can be not getting that promotion.  Social media passive aggressive post. Commenting on work performance negatively, and talking in derogatory terms.
attributes.additional_details: Workplace Bullying is rife. A real problem, that can have severe consequences to a person being bullied. Just because a manager may smile at you, does not mean that they aren't bullying someone else.

attributes.action: Create abandoned buildings suitable for the homeless
attributes.background: To many people are living on the streets, we have so many abandoned buildings that arnt being used at all we need to open these buildings for the homeless, free of charge or affordable for them.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax for people who are earning under £43,000 from 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: People all over the United Kingdom work very hard for their money that they earn, and are being taxed way too much. If 5% was reduced from the general tax rate, employees would be much happier with their jobs. Unemployed people will be more likely to work as the salary rates will be more appealing.

attributes.action: Clerks of the House of Commons to continue wearing wigs and court dress
attributes.background: We believe that changes to the attire of the clerks after the February recess fail to take account of the traditions of the House of Commons.  The so called 'executive order' needs to be debated be repealed.  It ain't broke, so don't fix it

attributes.action: Make toll roads free for HGV's
attributes.background: With rising costs associated with running haulage companies including fuel, road tax, operator licence fees e.t.c toll roads are a cost that should be wavered for HGV. A prime example being the M6 toll. Allowing HGV'S to use this for free would have a massively positive impact on congestion.

attributes.action: Compel energy providers to offer the cheapest tariffs on pre-pay meters.
attributes.background: Users of pre-pay meters are unfairly disadvantaged when purchasing energy to heat their homes. Although often on lower incomes they actually have to pay a higher rate. This is "fuel poverty" - higher tariffs result in people going without food or other essentials as they just try to keep warm.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/19/fuel-poverty-heating-disabled-cold-penalised-energy-tariff

attributes.action: Stop bombing syria and provide support.
attributes.background: In syria a child's life is worth a bullet in the chamber of a soldier, the lives of all the mothers and children that die are only seen as colletral damage to the superpowers of the world, thats why i believe support from the united kingdom would be of much help to re-developing a nation.

attributes.action: Legalise the pharmaceutical production of THC for medicinal purposes.
attributes.background: Across the world THC has been proven to benefit a massive range of medical issues, from Anxiety disorders to Parkinson's disease. It is a neuropathic relaxant and can give those in need more control therefore enhancing their wellbeing, independence and reduces the use of other treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against this is the fear of drug abuse - which is already unregulated and rife. Unlike alcohol and tobacco; there is no evidence of overdose, violence or suicide under the influence of THC. It's neuropathic relaxants enhance endorphins.
In legalising the pharmaceutical production, companies can create a medicated and prescribable form of THC which can be monitored and managed by clinicians.
Presently, there are no controls and those in medical need suffer in desperation.

attributes.action: Set up of a Men's Equality committee to address issues like male rape & suicide.
attributes.background:
There is already a Women & Equalities Committee, but it has not yet done any inquiries into issues facing men, such as; 
1* Suicide (three times as high in men) 
2* Male rape (where services for men are insufficient) 
3* Domestic violence against men (misreported as only affecting women).
attributes.additional_details:
1. suicide rates by gender 16.8 per 100,000 for men and 5.2 per 100,000 for women from Samaritans website http://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide 
2. 85,000 women and 12,000 men raped per year. http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
3. 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men - http://www.lwa.org.uk/understanding-abuse/statistics.htm”
